name: Sum of the legs of the unique primitive Pythagorean triple (a,b,c) such that (a-b+c)/2 = A000032(n) and its long leg and hypotenuse are consecutive natural numbers.
reference: Miguel Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, José Manuel Sánchez Muñoz and José Miguel Blanco Casado, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas, Preprint 2025.
link: Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega, El Libro de las Ternas Pitagóricas
example: For n=3, the short leg is A382379(3,1) = 5 and the long leg is A382379(3,2) = 12 so the sum of the legs is then a(2) = 5 + 12 = 17.
author: _Miguel-Ángel Pérez García-Ortega_, Apr 13 2025
